repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: The Harlow Estate was located in Essex, England. This collection includes proceedings of manorial courts and records of quit rents, tithes, and other income received.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Records
bioghist.p: The Harlow Estate was located in Essex, England. The estate managers were William James and James Taylor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains proceedings of manorial courts and records of quit rents, tithes, and other income received by estate managers William Janes and James Taylor for the Harlow Estate (including Lindsell and Beamond).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Harlow Estate Records, 1658-1694. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Harlow Estate Records).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from dealer Blackwell in 1967.
